ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Therefore be patient with a patience which is beautiful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So, (O Prophet), persevere with gracious perseverance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Therefore patiently endure, in the best manner (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So be patient, with a good patience.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Therefore endure with a goodly patience.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So be thou patient with a sweet patience;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But be patient (O Muhammad) with a patience fair to see.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Therefore, [O believers] behave with seemly patience.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Wherefore be thou patient with a becoming patience.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So be patient, with a patience that is graceful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Therefore do thou hold Patience,- a Patience of beautiful (contentment).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So be patient (O Muhammad SAW), with a good patience.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Therefore be patient, with a beautiful patience;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So be patient, with sweet patience.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So be patient with gracious patience.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:5] So be patient — this was [revealed] before he [the Prophet] was commanded to fight — with a graceful patience, that is, one in which there is no anguish.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But be patient) O Muhammad, in the face of their harm (with a patience fair to see) i.e. without anguish or display of indecency; and it is also said this means: stay away from them and show no anguish or indecency. 692 Later, he was commanded to fight them.
